title: Isabella Rossellini: My Wild Life - Alem do Cinema - sub: PT-BR
description:
The daughter of one of the most mythical couples of cinema, Ingrid Bergman and Roberto Rossellini, Isabella rapidly stepped out of her parents' shadow to become a living legend in her own original and exotic way. We think we know everything about the model, muse and award-winning actress, who has been married to famous husbands. But Isabella is so much more than the glamorous star we think we know. She is a woman who fights with conviction and passion. She campaigns openly in favour of abortion in a viscerally Catholic Italy, speaks about her rape, and interprets the role of male animals in her own series of short films, "Green Porno". This documentary is a journey with Isabella Rossellini through her life and her world, from Rome to New York, via Paris and Patagonia, from her Italian childhood to her commitment to protecting threatened animals, via her rich artistic career.
